title: 1930s Screwball Comedies
description: Fast-talking dames, madcap misunderstandings, and uproarious laughter -- revisit the golden age of screwball comedy!

questions.question: Which 1934 film starring Clark Gable and Claudette Colbert is considered the first great screwball comedy?
'It Happened One Night' was the first film to win all five major Academy Awards. Which were they?
Carole Lombard starred opposite William Powell as a socialite who hires a homeless man as a butler in which 1936 film?
In 'Bringing Up Baby' (1938), Katharine Hepburn's character has a pet of what kind?
Who directed 'Bringing Up Baby' and 'His Girl Friday'?
In 'The Thin Man' (1934), William Powell and Myrna Loy play Nick and Nora Charles. What is Nick's profession?
Which 1938 film features Cary Grant and Katharine Hepburn in a madcap adventure involving a dinosaur bone?
Frank Capra directed which 1934 screwball comedy about a runaway heiress and a reporter?
options: You Can't Take It with You

questions.question: Carole Lombard was married to which famous leading man before her tragic death in a plane crash in 1942?
In 'Twentieth Century' (1934), John Barrymore plays a theatrical producer trying to win back which actress?
Which director was known as the 'King of Screwball Comedy' and created 'The Lady Eve' and 'Sullivan's Travels'?
Jean Arthur played a witty, fast-talking woman in which 1938 Frank Capra comedy about an eccentric family?
options: You Can't Take It with You

questions.question: What is the 'Lubitsch Touch,' named after director Ernst Lubitsch?
options: Elegant, witty, and sophisticated comedic style

questions.question: In 'Nothing Sacred' (1937), Carole Lombard plays a woman who pretends to be dying of what?
Which screwball comedy element distinguishes the genre from other comedies of the era?
options: Battle of the sexes between equally matched protagonists
